questions.text: Log DRC of four drugs is shown in the given diagram. Which of the following statements is correct about these drugs?

options.label: B
options.text: Drug A and C are equipotent

options.label: C
options.text: Drug B is more efficacious and less potent than drug A

options.label: D
options.text: Drug A and C are equiefficacious

questions.correct_answer: D. Drug A and C are equiefficacious
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Drug A and C are

questions.text: A 25-year-old man presented with a severe, electric pain over posterior tongue and pharynx. It starts suddenly, lasts 1-2 minutes and precipitated by swallowing. Which of the following medications is indicated at this time?

A 56-year-old man presented with the sudden onset of a severe headache. He was awake, but feeling uncomfortable because of headache. His initial plain CT head was normal. Lumbar puncture was performed and CSF was shown below. What is the next step?
Which of the following cancers and the Immunohistochemistry (IHC) marker is not correctly matched?
Hepatitis B is associated with increased risk of liver cancer in patients because of?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased survival time in host cells

options.label: C
options.text: Enhanced release of tumour suppressor gene products

options.label: D
options.text: Integration of viral RNA with host DNA

questions.correct_answer: B. High rate of hepatocyte proliferation
questions.explanation: Ans. B. High rate of hepatocyte proliferation

questions.text: Which of the following electrocardiograph waveform is matched correctly to the cardiac cycle?

Mr. Smith, a 55-year-old male patient, has been diagnosed with laryngeal malignancy and is scheduled to undergo modified radical neck dissection (MRND). The surgery is being performed in a sitting position to provide the surgeon with better access to the operative field. The anaesthetic team has taken all necessary precautions to prevent any complications during the surgery. During the surgery, while ligating the internal jugular vein, the patient's end-tidal carbon dioxide (etCO2) dropped from 40 mmHg to 14 mmHg. The patient suddenly developed hypotension along with cardiac arrhythmia, and the surgical team immediately recognized the emergency situation. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

A 5-month-old girl was brought to the casualty with seizures. The paediatrician tries to do CSF sampling. What are the structures punctured by the paediatrician while piercing through anterior fontanelle?
Advanced bipolar energy sources can coagulate vessels directly of diameter?
A Female had a thorn prick 5 years ago. She presented with a slowly growing 2 × 2 cm verrucous lesion which on KOH mount showed the following image. Identify the condition?

A 65-year-old male with a history of atrial fibrillation and recent coronary artery bypass graft surgery presents with bleeding from the surgical wound site. Laboratory tests reveal a normal platelet count and coagulation panel. Thromboelastography (TEG) is ordered to assess the patient's clotting profile. Which of the following TEG tracings is most consistent with the patient's presentation?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced R-time, increased angle, increased MA, increased LY30

options.label: B
options.text: Prolonged R-time, decreased angle, decreased MA, decreased LY30

options.label: C
options.text: Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced R-time, decreased angle, increased MA, decreased LY30

questions.correct_answer: C. Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30

questions.text: James is a 2-year-old boy who has been struggling with social interaction and communication. He doesn't make eye contact with others, doesn't respond to his name being called, and has delayed speech development. He is often fixated on certain objects or activities and gets upset when his routine is disrupted. What could be the possible diagnosis in this child?
Match the following therapeutic methods used in the management of psoriasis with their possible side effects?

A 32-year-old woman is suffering from common cold visited the hospital with complain of vomiting since three days and extreme weakness. Her examination and lab findings are as follow: BP - 90/60mmHg Pulse - 110/ min RR - 10/min Blood pH - 7.6 Plasma bicarbonate - 30mEq/L What should be patient’s current acid-base status and hormone involved?

options.label: B
options.text: Metabolic alkalosis, aldosterone and angiotensin II

options.label: C
options.text: Respiratory acidosis, aldosterone and angiotensin II

questions.correct_answer: B. Metabolic alkalosis, aldosterone and angiotensin II

questions.text: Identify the Diagram shown in the image below?

A 24-year-old male is brought to the psychiatry emergency department by his family members. They report that he has been muttering to himself, exhibiting suspicious behaviour, and believing that neighbours are conspiring against him by video recording him. He has not attended work for the last three months. Over the past month, he has become more withdrawn, speaking minimally, and has been observed standing in his room at the same place for hours. In the last two days, the patient has stopped speaking completely and has refused food and water. In the emergency department, the patient did not respond to any questions and stood as given in the image below for 30 minutes. What is the best next step in the management of this patient?

A 45-year-old male patient presents to their primary care physician with a complaint of dysphagia. He reports that he experiences a sensation of food getting stuck in his throat when he eats. He also reports some mild chest discomfort with exertion. The patient has a history of Down syndrome and congenital heart disease. Which imaging modality is typically used to diagnose dysphagia lusoria?

A 10-year-old boy came with complaints of anaemia, weakness, with low weight to height ratio for his age profile. On examination, urine sample shows elevated level of orotic acid. Further study reveals low uridine monophosphate (UMP) synthase activity. What can be the best treatment to administer?
Identify the false statement from the following:

options.label: A
options.text: True positive fistula test indicates perilymph fistula

options.label: B
options.text: False positive fistula test indicates congenital syphilis

options.label: C
options.text: True negative fistula test indicates late stages of Meniere’s disease

options.label: D
options.text: False negative fistula test indicates dead labyrinth

questions.correct_answer: C. True negative fistula test indicates late stages of Meniere’s disease
questions.explanation: Ans. C. True negative fistula test indicates late stages of Meniere’s disease

questions.text: Police officers found a completely burnt dead body of a person in a forest. They suspect that someone might have killed him and later burnt the dead body to avoid identification. Doctor while conducting the post-mortem, found a significant finding in the larynx as shown below. This is suggestive of?
Rearrange the sequence of hand washing:
Which of the following is NOT one of the three clinical diagnostic criteria for bacterial vaginosis described by Amsel?

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina

options.label: C
options.text: Clue cells seen on vaginal saline preparation by light microscopy

options.label: D
options.text: Characteristic fishy odour release with addition of potassium hydroxide to vaginal secretions

questions.correct_answer: B. Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina

questions.text: A 45-year-old male with a history of epilepsy presents to the dentist with complaints of difficulty in eating and cleaning the teeth. On Examination, the findings were shown as seen in the diagram below. The patient reports that he has been taking an anti-epileptic drug for the past six months, and his symptoms began to appear gradually over the past few weeks. Which of the following anti-epileptic drugs is likely to produce these adverse effects?

A 28-year-old patient presents with the sadness of mood, frequent crying spells, insomnia, occasional suicidal thoughts, and lack of energy. The psychiatrist decides to start him on antidepressants, but the patient mentions that he is about to get married in one month and is concerned about the potential sexual side effects of the medication. Which of the following antidepressants should be prescribed to this patient?
Which of the following is not seen in heart failure?
Match the following scale types with their lesions:

Which of the following are branches of the anterior division of the internal iliac artery? Superior gluteal artery Inferior gluteal artery Superior vesical artery Middle rectal artery Inferior vesical artery Vaginal artery
Which procedure is shown in the following picture?
Which of the following is NOT an exception to oral evidence in court?

A victim of road traffic accident was brought into the casualty with shortness of breath and pain in the right upper part of his chest. Inspection revealed bruising over the right chest wall. On palpation, there was associated tenderness in the area and a chest X-ray showed the following picture. Which of these is the first step of definitive management in this case?
questions.correct_answer: C. Opiate analgesia, oxygen, chest physiotherapy
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Opiate analgesia, oxygen, chest physiotherapy

questions.text: A 68-year-old man with a history of myocardial infarction and congestive heart failure is comfortable at rest. However, when walking to his car, he develops dyspnea, fatigue, and sometimes palpitations. He must rest for several minutes before these symptoms resolve. Which of the following is his New York Heart Association classification?
Maximum cell size in bacterial cell growth cycle is seen in which phase?
A 32y woman is seeking a contraceptive method. The gynaecologist prescribes the below shown contraceptive. Which of the following describes best the mechanism of action of this contraceptive?

A 60-year-old female with a history of glaucoma presents to the ophthalmologist with complaints of blurred vision and eye irritation. The patient reports that she has been using an anti-glaucoma medication for the past six months, and her symptoms began to appear gradually over the past few weeks. Upon further evaluation, it is discovered that the patient has experienced darkening of the iris and eyelid skin as well as increased length, thickness, and pigmentation of the eyelashes. Which of the following anti-glaucoma drugs is likely to produce these adverse effects?
Physiologists divided the nerve fibres into specific groups based on the myelination and thickness of nerve fibres. Select the incorrect characteristic of nerve fibres in different groups?

options.label: A
options.text: Type C fibres are small unmyelinated nerve fibres that conduct impulses at low velocities

options.label: B
options.text: Type A fibres are the typically large and medium-sized myelinated fibres of spinal nerves

options.label: C
options.text: Type B are further subdivided into α, β, and δ fibres

options.label: D
options.text: Subset of type A fibres has conduction velocity between 70-120 m/s

questions.correct_answer: C. Type B are further subdivided into α, β, and δ fibres
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Type B fibres are further subdivided into α, β, and δ fibres

questions.text: A study was done in 3 states to see the mean blood pressure in each community. Health workers were assigned and they visited each house in the three communities. Mean blood pressure in each community was found and compared. What type of study design is represented here?

A patient Vinod, who has taken the first COVID vaccine comes for the second dose. A nurse noticed that the shoulder was flabby, flat, and was asymmetrical. There was an associated loss of contour of the shoulder joint. Injury to which of the structures might have resulted and was avoidable?
A bodybuilder starts eating raw eggs for protein. He developed fatigue on moderate exercise. The doctor prescribes a vitamin. Which enzyme will be negatively affected in him?

65-year-old man presents with progressive dyspnoea & pulmonary function testing was done. FEV1 is 2.5 L (78% predicted), FVC is 4.00 L (94% predicted), and the FEV1/FVC ratio is 62.5%. The flow-volume curve is shown. What is the most likely cause?

A patient was brought to the hospital with fever, headache and neck stiffness. CSF tap showed increased protein, mildly decreased glucose and lymphocytosis. The CSF tap image with its microscopic picture is given below. What is the diagnosis?

A 24y P2L2 who does not want more children presents to the OPD as she cannot feel the thread of the Multiload 375 that was inserted 3 years earlier. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks earlier. On examination, the cervix appears normal, and the thread is not seen. A transvaginal scan shows the following image. What is the next best step?

options.label: C
options.text: Remove the IUCD with a hook

questions.text: A 33-year-old woman presents with a 3-day history of seeing "spots" floating around in her right eye. Today, she notes streaks of light in the same eye accompanied by a "shadow" in her peripheral vision that moves when looking up and down. Her medical history is significant for migraine headaches; however, she has never had such visual symptoms with her headaches. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old male presents with fatigue, night sweats, and weight loss. A complete blood count (CBC) is performed, and the peripheral blood smear shows the presence of cells with increased basophilic cytoplasm, granulocytic precursors, and a high percentage of blasts. A bone marrow biopsy is performed. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this patient's condition?
A 36-year-old patient who has been smoking for the past 16 years expresses a desire to quit smoking. Which medication is most effective for this patient in smoking cessation?
A 30-year-old female came to the OPD with complaints of backache. On examination, her eyes and pinna revealed blackish discoloration. What is the likely diagnosis?
A child presents to you with itchy lesions on the scalp with hair loss as shown in the image below. What would be the next best step?

A 35-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of chronic lower back pain and stiffness that has been progressively worsening over the past few months. He also reports a family history of similar symptoms. After conducting a physical examination, the physician suspects that the patient may be suffering from ankylosing spondylitis. Which of these is most specific for ankylosing spondylitis:

A woman presents with a breast tumour of size 6 x 3cm, with adherence to the pectoralis major muscle. Only the dermis of the overlying skin is found to be involved. As her surgeon, what will you designate her T (tumour) staging as?

A 78-year-old woman is admitted to the ICU with pneumonia. Since she was in marked respiratory distress, she was intubated in the emergency. The ventilator is set in the assist control mode with a RR of 24 breaths/min, tidal volume of 6 mL/kg, FiO2 of 1.0 and PEEP of 12 cmH 2 O. An ABG is performed – the results are pH of 7.20, PaCO 2 of 32 mmHg, and PaO 2 of 54 mmHg. What is the cause of the hypoxemia?
What is the mechanism of action of the toxin produced by the bacterium shown in the figure below?

Which characteristics are risk factors for malignant transformation of the structural lesion shown in the hysteroscopic image? Tamoxifen use Postmenopausal state Size > 1.5 cm Use of OCPs Early menopause

A 22-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department because of a 1-day history of double vision and rapidly worsening pain and swelling of her right eye. She had an upper respiratory infection a week ago after which she has had nasal congestion, recurrent headaches and a purulent nasal discharge. She took antibiotics for her respiratory tract infection but did not complete the course. She has asthma treated with Theophylline and inhaled beta-adrenergic agonist and corticosteroids. She appears to be in severe distress. Her temperature is 38.5°C pulse is 100/min and BP is 130/80 mmHg. Ophthalmic examination of the right eye, shows proptosis and diffuse oedema, erythema and tenderness of the eyelids. Right eye movements are restricted and painful in all directions. The pupils are equal and reactive to light. There is tenderness to palpation over the right cheek and purulent nasal discharge in the right nasal cavity. The left eye shows no abnormalities. Laboratory studies show a leukocyte count of 12,000 per millimetre cube. Which of the following provides the strongest indication for administering intravenous antibiotics to this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Oedema, erythema and tenderness of the eyelids

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding Aducanumab?

options.label: A
options.text: Aducanumab is an anticoagulant drug used to prevent blood clots

options.label: B
options.text: Aducanumab is a monoclonal antibody used in the treatment of Alzheimer's disease

options.label: C
options.text: Aducanumab is a chemotherapy drug used in the treatment of cancer

options.label: D
options.text: Aducanumab is a vaccine used to prevent HIV infection

questions.correct_answer: B. Aducanumab is a monoclonal antibody used in the treatment of Alzheimer's disease
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Aducanumab is a monoclonal antibody used in the treatment of Alzheimer's disease.

questions.text: Identify the correctly matched pair amongst the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Facilitated Diffusion – Ca 2 + into Sarcoplasmic Reticulum

questions.text: A neonate is lethargic, drowsy, and irritable with blood analysis showing hyperammonemia and orotic aciduria. Considering this patient, orotic acid levels are high due to which of the following?
questions.correct_answer: C. Bypassing carbamoyl phosphate synthetase II (CPS-II)
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Bypassing carbamoyl phosphate synthetase II (CPS-II)

questions.text: A 63-year-old man with COPD presents to you with dyspnea. Which of the following therapies is most likely to prolong his survival?

A child presents with sepsis. The bacteria isolated from blood showed beta hemolysis on blood agar, resistance to bacitracin, and a positive cAMP test. The most probable organism causing infection is:

Sophie is a 2-year-old girl who has been experiencing episodes of fainting and stiffness. These episodes are typically triggered by pain, such as when she falls or bumps into something. During the episodes, Sophie becomes stiff and unresponsive for a few seconds before losing consciousness and falling to the ground. Her parents take her to a paediatrician, who refers her to a neurologist for further evaluation. Identify the condition:
Arrange the following in the correct sequence of events in the cardiac cycle?

options.label: A
options.text: a wave of JVP, first heart sound, c wave of JVP, second heart sound

options.label: B
options.text: c wave of JVP, first heart sound, a wave of JVP, second heart sound

options.label: C
options.text: First heart sound, c wave of JVP, a wave of JVP, second heart sound

options.label: D
options.text: First heart sound, a wave of JVP, c wave of JVP, second heart sound

questions.correct_answer: A. a wave of JVP, first heart sound, c wave of JVP, second heart sound
questions.explanation: Ans. A. a wave of JVP, first heart sound, c wave of JVP, second heart sound

questions.text: A patient has the following laboratory findings: Sodium – 138 mEq/L Potassium – 4.4 mEq/L Chloride – 112 mEq/L Bicarbonate – 8.0 mEq/L Arterial pH – 7.21 Which of the following is the most likely acid-base status?

options.label: B
options.text: Anion gap metabolic acidosis plus metabolic alkalosis

options.label: C
options.text: Anion gap metabolic acidosis plus normal anion gap metabolic acidosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Anion gap metabolic acidosis plus normal anion gap metabolic acidosis

questions.text: A person presents with pneumonia. His sputum was sent for culture. The bacterium obtained showed gram positive cocci in chains on microscopy and alpha haemolytic colonies on sheep agar. Which of the following will help in confirming the diagnosis?

A 30y P1 with a last menstrual period 10 days ago presents to the emergency with complaints of worsening right pelvic pain. She says that she had sudden onset of sharp pain after bending over to pick up her child. The pain did not respond to acetaminophen and has intermittently worsened during the past several hours. She also had 2 episodes of vomiting. On examination, there is abdominal guarding. Transvaginal sonography demonstrates an 8-cm enlarged right ovary. There is high impedance arterial flow of the ovary on colour Doppler. These findings are most consistent with which of the following clinical diagnoses?
Which of the following pituitary adenomas is likely to be hormonally ‘silent’?

Sarah is a 14-year-old girl who has been experiencing episodes of jerky movements and loss of consciousness. These episodes usually occur in the morning or after sleep deprivation, and they last only a few seconds. She has a habit of dropping objects like spoon and pencil from her hands and she notices repetitive muscle jerking while brushing her teeth. Sarah's parents take her to a neurologist for further evaluation. What is she diagnosed to be suffering from ?
Name the method of losing heat as shown in the image below:
The point X shown in the following enzyme kinetic plot represents which of the following value?
Which of these is a true statement about use of compression stockings in varicose veins?

options.label: A
options.text: No benefit in prevention or progression of disease

options.label: B
options.text: Class I stockings are used in venous ulcer

options.label: C
options.text: Provide equal improvements in quality of life and cost- effective compared to surgery

questions.correct_answer: A. No benefit in prevention or progression of disease
questions.explanation: Ans. A. No benefit in prevention or progression of disease

questions.text: Assertion – Bromocriptine is the preferred drug for prolactinoma when planning pregnancy. Reason – Bromocriptine is short acting.

options.label: A
options.text: Both assertion and reasons are independently true/correct statements and the reason is the correct explanation for the assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both assertion and reasons are independently true/correct statements, but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently a true/correct statement, but the reason is independently a false/incorrect statement

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently a false/incorrect statement, but the reason is independently a true/correct statement

questions.correct_answer: A. Both assertion and reasons are independently true/correct statements and the reason is the correct explanation for the assertion

questions.text: Match the following organism with their pathogenesis:

A 16y girl is brought to the OPD as she has not started her period. The patient’s 14y sister underwent menarche 2 years earlier and her mother began menstruating at age 13. She has no weight gain, headaches, nipple discharge or abdominal pain. She is not sexually active and is not using any method of contraception. She is physically active and is on her school’s basketball team. Her breast examination and pubic hair are Tanner stage IV. The abdomen is soft. The external genitalia appear normal. The vagina ends in a blind pouch. An ultrasound reveals ovaries, but no cervix or uterus is seen. Which is the most likely diagnosis?

In glycogen metabolism, a metabolically active important enzyme found in liver is converted from its inactive dephosphorylated state to its active phosphorylated state. Which of the following is true about this enzyme?

options.label: C
options.text: More commonly seen in fasting state than in fed state

options.label: D
options.text: Always activated by cAMP dependent protein kinase

questions.correct_answer: C. More commonly seen in fasting state than in fed state

questions.text: Which of these represents true gastro-esophageal (GE) junction tumour?

options.label: A
options.text: Located between 5 cm and 1 cm above GE junction

options.label: B
options.text: Located between 2 cm above and 1 cm below GE junction

options.label: C
options.text: Located between 1 cm above and 2 cm below GE junction

options.label: D
options.text: Located between 1 cm above and 1 cm below GE junction

questions.correct_answer: C. Located between 1 cm above and 2 cm below GE junction
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Located between 1 cm above and 2 cm below GE junction

questions.text: Which of the following genetic defect regarding Maturity Onset Diabetes in the Young (MODY) is incorrectly matched?
Identify two drawbacks of delayed cord clamping during delivery?

A young man presents with features of recurrent brief depressive disorder, each lasting for about 3 to 7 days, for over a year. He had history of occasional headache and episodes of swooning attack in between, usually precipitated by emotional events. His neuroimaging revealed agenesis of corpus callosum. He was experiencing swooning attacks as he became aware that some ‘unusual’ findings were present in his reports. Recurrent brief depression can be a manifestation of this congenital anomaly, and conversion disorder can be present as comorbid diagnosis perhaps due to ignorance and fear of this apparently innocuous congenital malformation. What is blood supply of corpus callosum?

options.label: A
options.text: Anterior cerebral artery and middle cerebral artery

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior cerebral artery and posterior cerebral artery

options.label: C
options.text: Anterior cerebral artery and anterior communicating artery

options.label: D
options.text: Middle cerebral artery and posterior cerebral artery

questions.correct_answer: C. Anterior cerebral artery and anterior communicating artery
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Anterior cerebral artery and anterior communicating artery

questions.text: The tensile strength of collagen fibres is provided by its triple helical structure, which can be most accurately described as which of the following level of protein structure?
Shown below is a popular sign that occurs in acute appendicitis. What is the name of this sign?
Which of the following assisted reproductive technologies (ART) techniques is shown in the image below?

A 5-year-old child presents with perivascular IgA deposition and neutrophilic collection. There is rash on the lower limbs and non-blanching purpura. Which of the following diagnosis best describes this condition?
Which is not a radiosensitizer?
Which of the following is not a treatment option for fistula in ano?

A 1-day old baby is evaluated in the emergency department due to poor feeding, repeated bilious vomiting and not passing meconium since birth. Abdominal examination reveals a distended abdomen. Imaging shows the following picture. Identify the condition in this patient?

A military soldier presents with fever, rash and myalgia. There is an absence of rash in his palms and soles. There is a history of louse infestation in the same battalion. What could be the causative organism?
Identify the true statement from the following regarding Rabies Immunoglobulin?

options.label: A
options.text: It is not useful after 72 hours

options.label: B
options.text: Maximum dose is given in deltoid muscle

options.label: C
options.text: Equine Rabies Immunoglobulin (ERIg) dose is 20 IU per kg

options.label: D
options.text: If human IG is not present, then give equine IG

questions.correct_answer: D. If human IG is not present, then give equine IG
questions.explanation: Ans. D. If human IG is not present, then give equine IG

questions.text: A 50-year-old male patient who is a known alcoholic presented with complaints of chronic pain in the epigastric region with occasional flare-ups of the pain over a background discomfort. He also complains of greasy stools that stick to the pan. Which substance in stools can be measured to test for pancreatic function in this case?
Which of the following statements is not true about direct pathway of alloantigen presentation?

options.label: A
options.text: The allogenic MHC molecules on graft’s antigen presenting cells are presented to the recipient’s helper T cells.

options.label: B
options.text: Responsible for most of the acute graft rejections mediated by cytotoxic T cells

options.label: C
options.text: Seen if graft tissues contain macrophages and dendritic cells

options.label: D
options.text: The donor alloantigens are processed and presented by recipient antigen presenting cells

questions.correct_answer: D. The donor alloantigens are processed and presented by recipient antigen presenting cells
questions.explanation: Ans. D. The donor alloantigens are processed and

questions.text: By which of the following methods are Culture media sterilized by?

27-year-old woman is admitted to the ICU after recent delivery of a full-term infant 3 days prior. The patient was found to have right hemiparesis and livedo reticularis. Lab reports – WBC 10200/μL, Hematocrit 35%, and platelet count of 13,000/μL. Peripheral smear reveals no schistocytes. Her Urea is 72 mg/dL, and her creatinine is 2.3 mg/dL. She has history of three prior pregnancy losses. Which of the following laboratory studies will best confirm the underlying etiology of her presentation?
Caudal regression sequence is increased in which maternal medical complication?

A 40 months old child has complained of pain in his abdominal region for the past 20 days. Physical examination reveals a palpable mass in the posterior abdomen. An abdominal CT scan shows a mass involving the left kidney. A nephrectomy is performed and the specimen is shown here. Which of the following indicates high risk of malignancy in the opposite kidney?

options.label: D
options.text: Abnormal persistent clusters of embryonal cells

questions.correct_answer: D. Abnormal persistent clusters of embryonal cells
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Abnormal persistent clusters of embryonal cells

questions.text: Which of the following pattern recognition receptors is useful for detection of viral RNA?
Which of the following is orally active direct Xa inhibitor?

A 25-year-old patient with no significant medical history presents to the emergency department with a fever of 102°F and altered sensorium. Upon examination, you notice a petechial rash on the patient's arms and legs. You suspect meningococcal septicaemia. Which of the following antibiotics is recommended as the first-line empiric therapy?

A patient with history of travel to Africa developed jaundice with haemorrhagic fever and conjunctival effusion. He was given treatment but he died. Which of the following vaccines could have prevented his death?

A 63-year-old man with a history of diabetes and MI was admitted to the ICU 1 day ago with sepsis due to pneumococcal pneumonia with bacteraemia. He was started on antibiotics, fluids and noradrenaline to stabilize his BP. Over the past 2 hours, he has had increasing abdominal pain, distension, and bloody stools. Current BP- 100/50, HR- 100/min, RR- 22/min and SpO 2 - 93% on HFNO. He has a diffusely tender abdomen with no audible bowel sounds. An abdominal radiograph shows multiple small bowel air-fluid levels. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 65-year-old male presents with symptoms of urinary urgency, frequency, and nocturia. He has been diagnosed with overactive bladder and his previous medication (oxybutynin) was not effective in managing his symptoms. Which of the following drugs is a beta-3 adrenergic receptor agonist that may be effective in treating this patient's symptoms?
Correct statement about Vaccine Vial Monitor is:

options.label: A
options.text: Vial is usable if inner square is lighter than outer circle

options.label: B
options.text: Vial is usable if inner square is same colour as outer circle

options.label: C
options.text: Vial is usable if inner square is darker than outer circle

options.label: D
options.text: Vial is usable if inner square is black

questions.correct_answer: A. Vial is usable if inner square is lighter than outer circle
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Vial is usable if inner square is lighter than outer circle

questions.text: A 24y primigravida presents at 37 weeks gestation with headache, a BP of 170/102 mmHg and severe upper quadrant right abdominal pain. She is diagnosed with HELLP syndrome and undergoes a vaginal delivery following induction of labor. Following delivery, the right sided abdominal pain persists and she undergoes a CT scan. What is the likely abnormality to be found in the CT?

A morbidly obese diabetic woman was on metformin but could not achieve glycemic control. She has had a previous history of gallstone pancreatitis and the patient does not want to take injections. Which of the following would be suitable to reduce her glucose levels?
Given image shows the Log DRC of a drug alone (A) and in the presence of antagonists (B and C). Identify the type of antagonism shown in curve B and curve C?

options.label: A
options.text: B is competitive and C is non-competitive antagonist

options.label: B
options.text: B is non-competitive an C is competitive antagonist

questions.correct_answer: A. B is competitive and C is non-competitive antagonist
questions.explanation: Ans. B. B is competitive and C is non-competitive antagonist

questions.text: What does IP in the figure shown stands for?

options.label: A
options.text: Drug is an instant release preparation

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.text: Number of recommended Ante-natal visits minimum, as per WHO guidelines, are?
The formula given below is used to calculate?

A 55-year-old male patient with a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes is admitted to the hospital with fever, cough, and shortness of breath. On examination, his oxygen saturation level is 90% on room air. He is suspected to have COVID-19 which can be confirmed by using all of the following except?

A 70-year-old patient presented with decreased hearing in both ears, progressively increasing since 5 years. On otoscopy, tympanic membrane looked normal. Rinne’s test was positive on both sides and Weber’s test showed no response (no sounds were heard in any ear when tuning fork was kept on the forehead). Impedance showed type A curve with intact stapedial reflex. In pure tone audiometry among the following audiograms, what could be the correct one in this patient?

A police officer brings a 15-year-old male child to the doctor for medical examination. The mother of the child gives history of sexual assault of the child by his uncle since 2 years. A thorough examination is performed on the child. Anal examination shows features suggestive of:
questions.correct_answer: B. Repeated anal sex with child
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Repeated anal sex with child

questions.text: A 26y woman who is currently living with her partner visits for cervical cancer screening. She has been in 3 earlier relationships. What is the screening method recommended?

A woman presents to you complaining of a red, watering eye for the past two days with stinging and some photophobia. Her vision has dropped slightly to 20/30. She has a history of diabetes and taking drops for glaucoma, but is otherwise healthy. The most likely cause of her redness is:
Which of the following statements is true regarding phase zero clinical trials?

options.label: A
options.text: Phase zero clinical trials are conducted in healthy volunteers

options.label: B
options.text: Phase zero clinical trials are designed to test the efficacy of a new drug

options.label: C
options.text: Phase zero clinical trials typically involve large groups of participants

options.label: D
options.text: Phase zero clinical trials are sometimes referred to as therapeutic trials

questions.correct_answer: A. Phase zero clinical trials are conducted in healthy volunteers
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Phase zero clinical trials are conducted in healthy volunteers

questions.text: A 60-year-old man presents to the clinic with a complaint of knee pain. The physician orders an X-ray of the affected knee, which is as shown in the image below. Identify the true statement regarding this condition from the options given below?

options.label: D
options.text: Bipartite patella; X ray of other knee

questions.correct_answer: D. Bipartite patella; X ray of other knee
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Bipartite patella; X ray of other knee

questions.text: Which of the following statements about high flow nasal cannula (HFNC) is true?

options.label: A
options.text: HFNC is contraindicated in patients with respiratory distress

options.label: B
options.text: HFNC delivers oxygen at a flow rate of less than 5 L/min

options.label: C
options.text: HFNC can provide positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP)

options.label: D
options.text: HFNC is only used for short-term oxygen therapy

questions.correct_answer: C. HFNC can provide positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP)
questions.explanation: Ans. C. HFNC can provide positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP)

questions.text: A 35-year-old male, diagnosed with squint presented to the ophthalmology department for regular check-up. On examination, marked muscle was found affected. At which level does the nerve supply for the marked structure arise?
In a degloving injury, which of the following components are stripped off?

options.label: D
options.text: Skin, superficial, deep fascia and muscles

questions.text: You are seeing Mr. Dayalan who is a 24-year-old previously healthy athlete. He is in for his employer-required physical examination. Which of the following rhythms is demonstrated in the figure?

options.label: B
options.text: Mobitz type I, second-degree heart block

options.label: C
options.text: Mobitz type II, second-degree heart block

questions.correct_answer: B. Mobitz type I, second-degree heart block

questions.text: A 30-year-old patient with history of recurrent headache was sent for fundus evaluation. He was found to be having generalised arteriolar attenuation with multiple cotton wool spots and flame shaped haemorrhages in both eyes as shown in the picture given. The most likely cause is?

A patient presented with fever, weight loss and night sweats. He had 2 previous episodes of haemoptysis. His radiograph showed a cavitory lesion in the right lung. Which of the following is the mechanism of cavitation in his lungs?

options.label: A
options.text: Mast cell degranulation due to cross linking of IgE

options.label: B
options.text: Vasculitis due to immune complex formation

questions.text: Lizy is a 4-year-old girl who has been experiencing developmental delays since birth. She has difficulty with motor skills, including walking and using her hands. She also has trouble communicating with others, has hand wringing movements and often appears to be in her own world. Her parents have taken her to numerous doctors and specialists, but none have been able to provide a definitive diagnosis?

A 3-Year-old baby is brought to her paediatrician for a check-up. Stroking the plantar surface of the foot produces a reflex extension of the large toe rather than the expected flexion. The Babinski sign elicited by the physician indicates damage to which of the following?
Identify the distribution represented by ‘diagram 3’ in the Image below?

A 30-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of hip pain. An X-ray of her proximal femur is ordered to evaluate the underlying cause of the pain. The X-ray reveals a deformity in the proximal femur which is called:

You are in the operating room and notice the tracing in gray color waveform on the electrocardiogram (ECG) device. The patient is a 65-year-old male undergoing coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery. What does the gray color waveform on the ECG indicate?
A patient presented with pallor and cyanosis with following presentation. This condition is most probably due to?
A young 23-year-old black man presents with the clinical picture shown in the right eye after blunt injury. All of the following are acceptable initial treatments except?
questions.correct_answer: D. Carbonic anhydrase inhibitor pressure drops
questions.explanation: Ans. D.  Carbonic anhydrase inhibitor pressure drops

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman has noted painless enlargement of her neck for the past month. On physical examination, she has diffuse, symmetrical thyroid enlargement without tenderness on palpation. Laboratory studies show her serum TSH is elevated but serum thyroxine is lower side of normal limits. Her microscopic examination is shown here. Which of the following laboratory test findings is she most likely to have?
questions.correct_answer: B. High anti-thyroid peroxidase antibody titre
questions.explanation: Ans. B. High anti-thyroid peroxidase antibody titre

questions.text: Lila is a 4-year-old girl who was recently hospitalized for meningitis. She received treatment and was discharged from the hospital, but her parents noticed that she was not responding to sounds and seemed to be having trouble hearing. What could be the possible diagnosis?

A 23-year-old medical student presents to the surgery emergency department after cutting her wrist with a blade. After receiving first aid, the resident notices multiple healed cut marks on her wrist. Upon psychiatry referral, the patient informs the resident that she cut herself because she was feeling very angry at her boyfriend who spent the entire evening watching an IPL match rather than calling her. She also mentions that she has never been in a relationship with a guy for more than 2 months and believes that all men are horrible, while women are the best. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 32-year-old male patient with a history of ulcerative colitis presents to the emergency department complaining of abdominal pain, distention, and fever. He reports having bloody diarrhoea and has been using mesalamine and prednisone to manage his condition. On physical examination, his abdomen is tender and distended, and bowel sounds are absent. Laboratory tests indicate leucocytosis and electrolyte imbalances. An erect abdominal X-ray was taken as shown. What is the likely diagnosis?

A patient presents to the outpatient department with a satellite skin lesion. On examination, he has one hypopigmented lesion and one thickened nerve. Images of two blister packs are given below. The treatment best suited for this patient would be?

A 45-year-old female patient who underwent a total knee replacement surgery two years ago complains of pain and a clicking sensation in her knee joint while extending it. Based on these symptoms, which of the following is true regarding the scar tissue in patellar clunk syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Superior pole of patella, impinging during flexion

options.label: B
options.text: Superior pole of patella, impinging during extension

options.label: C
options.text: Inferior pole of patella, impinging during flexion

options.label: D
options.text: Inferior pole of patella, impinging during extension

questions.correct_answer: B. Superior pole of patella, impinging during extension
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Superior pole of patella, impinging during extension

questions.text: Identify the device shown in the image below?

A 60-year-old man presented with unilateral hearing loss. Oto-endoscopic picture is shown below. Rinne’s test was negative and Weber’s test was lateralised to the same ear. Which view should be examined next in this patient?
Which of the following chelating agents is recommended for acute lead poisoning with signs of encephalopathy?

Three patients are brought to casualty after motor-vehicle accident with head injury.Their GCS assessment is as below: Patient A: E3V3M3 Patient B: E2V4M3 Patient C: E2V3M4 Who amongst them has the best prognosis?

Emily is a 10-year-old girl who has been experiencing headaches, vomiting, and vision problems. Her headache starts early in the morning and worsens on lying down. After several visits to her paediatrician, she is referred to a neurologist and undergoes imaging tests. What is the possible diagnosis?

A 65-year-old male with a history of chronic kidney disease presents to the emergency department with complaints of muscle weakness, nausea, and abdominal cramping. Laboratory testing shows that the patient has hyperkalaemia, with a serum potassium level of 6.5 mEq/L. The patient's medications are reviewed, and it is discovered that he has been taking several drugs for his cardiac conditions and hypertension. Upon further evaluation, it is determined that one of these drugs may be contributing to the patient's hyperkalaemia. Which of the following drugs should be stopped in this patient?

A medical student have given a topic to present in class. The topic given to you was excitation-contraction coupling. It is a process in which muscle cells are stimulated to contract and it is followed by muscle cell relaxation. It involves the following events: Action potential Calcium release into the cytoplasm Cross-bridge cycling Cytoplasmic calcium removal Depolarization of T tubules Which of the following options lists the correct sequence of events for excitation-contraction coupling in skeletal muscle tissue?
What is not true about the given graph?

options.label: D
options.text: It’s usually seen in smaller samples only

questions.correct_answer: D. It’s usually seen in smaller samples only
questions.explanation: Ans. D. It’s usually seen in smaller samples only

questions.text: Fibres from the marked structure end in which of the following areas of the thalamus?

A 45 years old man, who has a history of dyslipidaemia and coronary artery diseases presents with recurrent episodes of neuropathy. Oral examination reveal finding as shown in picture. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 15-year-old adolescent male presented with repeated episodes of profuse epistaxis and following features were seen. Identify the false statement regarding this condition:

options.label: A
options.text: Weber-Ferguson incision is used during surgical excision of this tumour

options.label: B
options.text: Biopsy should be done before performing surgery to know its nature

options.label: D
options.text: Proptosis can be caused by the intra-orbital extension of this tumour

questions.correct_answer: B. Biopsy should be done before performing surgery to know its nature
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Biopsy should be done before performing surgery to know its nature

questions.text: A 15-year-old male presents to emergency department in a comatose state. He was found in this state by his friend in the schoolyard. His friend confesses that the patient has been depressed over the past several days. His initial labs reveal hypocalcaemia and a severe metabolic acidosis. The urine shows calcium oxalate crystals. What was the toxin ingested?

Max is a 6-month-old boy who has been experiencing brief, sudden contractions that result in flexion of his body. His parents notice that these spasms occur in clusters throughout the day and are becoming more frequent. Max also seems to be experiencing developmental regression, as he has stopped babbling and seems to have difficulty with basic motor skills. Identify the condition he is suffering from?
See the Image given and identify the current placement of India in the cycle?

options.label: A
options.text: Stage 2 – Birth rate high and death rate declining

options.label: B
options.text: Stage 3 – Both birth rate and death rate declining

options.label: C
options.text: Stage 3 – Birth rate declining and death rate low

options.label: D
options.text: Stage 4 – Birth rate and death rate low

questions.correct_answer: B. Stage 3 – Both birth rate and death rate declining
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Stage 3 – Both birth rate and death rate declining

questions.text: Which of the following findings appear last in compartment syndrome?

A 75-year-old male presented with history of frequency, hesitancy & urgency for urination. He was on medication of Tamsulosin & Finasteride combination. Now Trans Urethral Resection of Prostate (TURP) surgery was recommended by physician. What is the volume of the prostate in normal adult males?
A 25-year-old female presented with a painless enlargement in the midline of her neck. Her TSH was 6.5 mIU/ml. The histology of the tissue is as follows. How will you diagnose this case?

Your 48-year-old patient presents with complaints of worsening menorrhagia. She has no other medical problems. Three-dimensional sonographic evaluation reveals the findings as shown below. All EXCEPT which of the following are suitable choices for medical treatment in this patient?

An elderly woman has had increasing dyspnoea for the past month. She underwent the histopathological finding which has been shown here. Which of the following chemical substances is most instrumental in the formation of the abnormality seen here?

Which of the following statements is/are true regarding anti-tubercular drugs? Isoniazid inhibits mycolic acid synthesis in the cell wall of Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Rifampicin is primarily used for the treatment of active tuberculosis and can cause liver toxicity and flu-like symptoms. Bedaquiline is a second-line anti-tubercular drug that can cause QT prolongation and requires cardiac monitoring. Pretomanid is primarily used as a monotherapy for the treatment of tuberculosis.
In recent years, incidence of noncommunicable diseases like diabetes and hypertension have increased. This is an example of:
Which structure from the options given below is supplied by the nerve that arises from the marked area in the image?

An 8-year-old child developed modest mental retardation and was brought to a physician. She had a history of vomiting, lethargy, convulsions, and hypertonia during her first week of life. Lab examination reported increased levels of Leucine, isoleucine, and valine in blood and urine. Which one of the following enzymes does this child lack?
A poorly controlled diabetic patient presented with the following picture. There was crepitus on palpation. All the following statements are true about this condition except?

options.label: A
options.text: Occurs due to gradual slowing of blood flow and desiccation of tissues

options.label: C
options.text: The black colour is due to iron sulphide formation from hemoglobin

questions.correct_answer: A. Occurs due to gradual slowing of blood flow and desiccation of tissues

questions.text: An elderly smoker had several episodes of hemoptysis in the past two weeks along with fatigue, headache, nausea, and anorexia. A chest radiograph shows an ill-defined hilar mass and the transbronchial lung biopsy is performed. The microscopic appearance is shown. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most likely to be present in this patient?

A 70-year-old male patient with a history of heart failure and atrial fibrillation has been taking digoxin for several months. He was recently started on a new medication for hypertension. He presents to the clinic with symptoms of nausea, vomiting, and visual disturbances. Which of the following drugs is most likely responsible for these symptoms?
All of the following are components responsible for the counter current mechanism in the kidney except?

options.label: A
options.text: Sodium outflow in thick ascending limb

options.label: B
options.text: Water outflow in thin descending limb

options.label: C
options.text: Sodium outflow in thin ascending limb

options.label: D
options.text: Flow of tubular fluid from PCT to DCT

questions.correct_answer: D. Flow of tubular fluid from PCT to DCT
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Flow of tubular fluid from PCT to DCT

questions.text: Which of the following immunization is done in elderly? 1 – Rota virus vaccine 2 – Meningococcal vaccine 3 – Diphtheria toxoid 4 – Varicella Zoster vaccine Mark the correct combination.
Which is not a branch of Anaesthetist’s artery?

A 65-year-old male patient with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is on theophylline therapy. He presents to the emergency department with symptoms of nausea, vomiting, and tremors. On examination, he has a heart rate of 110 beats per minute and a serum theophylline level of 30 mg/L (normal range 5-15 mg/L). Which of the following drugs is most likely responsible for the patient's symptoms?

A 32-year-old man met with a bike accident and handle of bike hit him badly that when he was brought to the hospital. Doctors find out that there is puncture in parietal pleura membrane. True about this condition is?

options.label: A
options.text: Unopposed inward recoil will be there

options.label: B
options.text: Intra thorax pressure will be zero

options.label: D
options.text: Only A and B are true

questions.correct_answer: D. Only A and B are true

questions.text: A women had two children named Ram and Shyam. One day, Shyam had Measles with fever and rash. After a few days, Ram developed the same symptoms. He was reported to the sub-centre. Which of the following is incorrect?

options.label: D
options.text: If mother had reported when Shyam got infection, Ram could have been vaccinated

questions.correct_answer: A. Ram is the index case
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Ram is the index case

questions.text: Which of the following structures passing via jugular foramen has a separate canal?
Which of the following anticancer drugs act at the target shown in figure?
Which of the following is false regarding PTH secretion?

options.label: A
options.text: Non-ionic calcium is most important stimulus for PTH secretion

options.label: B
options.text: Mg stimulates PTH secretion in the same way as Ca

options.label: C
options.text: Hypercalcemia in cancer patients is due to parathormone related protein.

options.label: D
options.text: Parathyroid senses calcium through calcium sensing receptor

questions.correct_answer: A. Non-ionic calcium is most important stimulus for PTH secretion
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Non-ionic calcium is most important stimulus for PTH secretion

questions.text: In India, pre-transfusion routine blood screening is recommended for all diseases except:

A 63-year-old man is treated with chemotherapy for lung cancer He presents with fever of 38.3°C (100.9°F). He is found to have erythema at the exit site of tunneled central venous catheter in the neck, although the tunnel itself is not tender or red. Blood cultures are negative at 48 hours. His neutrophil count is 1550/μL. What is the best approach to the management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Treatment with vancomycin and removal of catheter

options.label: C
options.text: Treatment with topical antibiotics at the catheter site

questions.text: This is a schematic diagram depicting body structure of which of these helminthes?
Match the following conditions and their presentations:

Study the statement given below for Screening methods. False statement(s) is/are? For colorectal cancer per rectal exam is used For breast cancer if mammography is done at 40 years’ age, females it's prevalence will increase For Cervical cancer, Pap smear is used For Oral cancer by examining from outside (visual inspection) is sufficient
Which of the following is likely with ascitic fluid protein 1.9 g/dL and a serum albumin ascites gradient (SAAG) of 1.4?

A 19-year-old sex worker was treated 2 days ago for presumed gonorrhea with ceftriaxone and azithromycin. She also has a palpable spleen. Laboratory examination is notable for a Hb of 5 g/dL with normal white blood cells and platelets. Peripheral blood smear shows an excess of spherocytes. Which of the following tests will most likely confirm the diagnosis?
Identify the following intracytoplasmic inclusion bodies isolated from brain biopsy?

A 52-year-old man has undergone lung transplantation. Two months after receiving lung transplant, he developed pulmonary symptoms and was diagnosed as having bilateral diffuse interstitial pulmonary pneumonitis and bronchiolitis. Which of the following etiological agent is responsible in this condition?
In vitro maturation of oocytes is a technique used in IVF pregnancies especially in women who have PCOS to prevent which complication?

A 34y G2 with twin pregnancy delivers in the labor room at 38 weeks. The intern who conducts the delivery is unsure about the chorionicity. The resident asks him to examine the placenta as shown. What can be confirmed about this placenta?

A middle aged male developed fever, weight loss, painless rubbery cervical lymphadenopathy and night sweats. He has undergone lymph node resection showing tumour cells having CD20+. Which of the following is true about this tumour?
Calculate the corrected reticulocyte count of a patient with haemoglobin of 5 and absolute reticulocyte count of 9%?
Pulmonary fibrosis is an adverse effect of which of the following anti-cancer drugs?
Which of the following drugs reversibly binds the site labelled as B in the given figure?
Most accurate investigation for local staging of Ca Prostate is:
Moynihan’s hump is an anatomical variation with respect to which of the below structures?

A 35-year-old woman with end stage renal disease on peritoneal dialysis presents to emergency with fever, altered mental status. Peritoneal fluid is withdrawn through her catheter and sent to the laboratory for analysis. The fluid white blood cell count is 125/μL with 85% polymorphonuclear neutrophils. Which organism is most likely to be found in the culture of the peritoneal fluid?

A patient with a history of Sjögren syndrome has the following laboratory findings: Sodium 139 mEq/L, chloride 112 mEq/L, bicarbonate 15 mEq/L and potassium 3.0 mEq/L. Urine studies show a pH of 6.0, sodium of 15 mEq/L, potassium of 10 mEq/L, and chloride of 12 mEq/L. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: B. Type I Renal Tubular Acidosis
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Type I Renal Tubular Acidosis

questions.text: A 25-year-old boy went for trekking, and came back with a rash. Weil Felix test revealed elevated OX 2 and OX 19 titers. What is the most likely causative organism?
An infant is born with congenital varicella as shown below. At what gestational age did the maternal infection most likely occur?

A 27y G2 is in labor. She is HIV positive and is on anti-retroviral drugs since the 1 st trimester. Which of the following medications used in the active management of 3 rd stage of labor should be avoided in women on anti-retroviral therapy?
A child with skin rash, reduced platelet count and high risk of infections should be evaluated for?

options.label: A
options.text: B cell tyrosine kinase activity detection

questions.text: Identify the incorrect statement regarding proton pump inhibitors?

options.label: B
options.text: Acts from the luminal side of gastric parietal cells

options.label: D
options.text: Should be taken on empty stomach

questions.correct_answer: B. Acts from the luminal side of gastric parietal cells
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Acts from the luminal side of gastric parietal cells

questions.text: As per the NTEP, high priority TB-HIV district is defined as?

options.label: A
options.text: >10% population of known HIV+ve among TB patients tested for HIV in the district

options.label: B
options.text: >12% population of known HIV+ve among TB patients tested for HIV in the district

options.label: C
options.text: >15% population of known HIV+ve among TB patients tested for HIV in the district

options.label: D
options.text: >20% population of known HIV+ve among TB patients tested for HIV in the district

questions.correct_answer: A. >10% population of known HIV+ve among TB patients tested for HIV in the district
questions.explanation: Ans. A. >10% population of known HIV+ve among TB patients tested for HIV in the district

questions.text: All are non-contraceptive benefits of Combined Oral contraceptive pills (OCPs) except?

A 30y primigravida delivers and following delivery of the placenta, she starts bleeding profusely. She is given oxytocin, methergine and carboprost and the following manoeuvre is done. What is the name of this manoeuvre?
Life cycle of which organism is depicted in the Image below?

A 46-year-old patient with multiple sclerosis for 20 years complained of stiffness in her legs. She used a wheelchair outside and a walker in the house. On examination, her legs were weak, with increased tone with passive movement. Which of the following is the most appropriate step in the treatment of this patient?
The World Health Organization identifies which of the following conditions as prohibitive of pregnancy?

options.label: D
options.text: Systemic ventricular dysfunction with Left ventricular ejection fraction of 35%

questions.text: You are monitoring a term patient who had a lower segment caesarean section 4 years earlier. She is 6 cm dilated, 80% effaced and the head is at -1 station. Ten minutes ago, she was comfortable and on epidural analgesia for pain relief. Now, you note the Fetal heart rate tracing which is as shown below. You examine the patient but cannot palpate the fetal head. The maternal pulse is 90/ min; BP is 84/46 mmHg. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Put the patient in Trendelenburg position

questions.text: You are applying a vacuum delivery for prolonged 2 nd stage in a primigravida. The resident asks you to apply the cup on the flexion point. Which point best describes this point on the image shown?

A new antiarrhythmic drug is found to be effective against both atrial and ventricular arrhythmias. Its effect on action potential is shown in the Figure. The effect of this new drug is most similar to?
Child Pugh Score for Chronic liver disease classified patients into three categories, namely, Category A (5-6), Category B (7-9) and Category C (10-15). This is a type of ____ variable/data now.
A 30-year-old patient presented with features of acute meningoencephalitis in the casualty. His CSF on wet mount microscopy revealed motile unicellular microorganism. The most likely organism is?
Match the Mullerian anomaly with the most likely presenting symptom?
